title: Purpose and Vision
description: Defining your purpose and vision clarifies the compelling reason for undertaking this initiative and provides a shared focus for the work that follows. Having a clear pupose and vision is necessary for alignment between all initiative components.

sections.title: Start with Your Why
sections.description: We have clearly defined a purpose and vision that includes the perspectives of critical stakeholders and articulates the compelling reason for undertaking this initiative.

responses.question: What is our compelling reason to undertake this initiative? What are the drivers?
subquestions: What research and evidence can we use to identify our purpose and vision? What data can help us identify drivers?
What perspectives need to be a part of defining our purpose and vision? What critical conversations can help identify drivers?
Which stakeholders need to be included in this work?

responses.question: What roles do personalized, competency-based learning and blended learning play in achieving our purpose and vision? What purpose does blended learning serve in relation to personalized, competency-based learning?
What are the benefits of taking action? What are the risks of not taking action?
What will be the ultimate impact?
subquestions: Who will be impacted, and how?
What is the impact for the district?

responses.question: How does the vision and mission of this initiative align with the broader work of our district?

assessment.question: Our rationale for undertaking this initiative is clearly articulated.
The relationships between personalized, competency-based learning and blended learning have been defined.
The impact of implementation is clear to all stakeholders.
This initiative is aligned with the strategic plan of our district.

resources.title: The Hexagon: An Exploration Tool Hexagon Discussion & Analysis Tool Instructions (National Implementation Research Network)
resources.description: This tool is most commonly used in the exploration stage to evaluate the fit and feasibility of implementing programs or practices in a given context.  It includes the tool, guidance and instructions for team use, and guiding questions.

resources.title: Management and Operations of Online Programs (Aurora Institute)
resources.description: As part of the Promising Practices in Online Learning series, page 24 of this resource includes a checklist for prioritizing drivers related to online learning environments. Many of these are also relevant for blended learning.

resources.title: The Shifting Paradigm of Teaching: Personalized Learning According to Teachers (KnowledgeWorks)
resources.description: As districts shift to personalize learning for students, this resource provides insight into how that shift impacts teachers as well as district policies and practices related to curriculum, instruction, assessment, learning environments, professional learning, technology, data, and partnerships.

resources.title: Levers and Logic Models: A Framework to Guide Research and Design of High-Quality Competency-Based Education Systems (Aurora Institute)
resources.description: Use logic model frameworks to convey relationships between essential levers (outcomes, drivers and mediating factors) that inform the design of competency-based education systems and critical components of competency-based practice at four interdependent levels (student experience, professional practice of educators, district and school systems and culture).

resources.title: Six Tips for Engaging Your Community in the Visioning Process (KnowledgeWorks)
resources.description: This article speaks to strategies for involving a broad group of stakeholders, including neighbors, business owners, community developers, higher education partners, elected officials and parents in creating a vision for personalized learning.
